package.description: The Logger class may be used to instrument an object with logging functionality. Application logging is handled by the Hemi.message.service.sendMessage function, which supports multiple levels of message levels and message scoping.

static-class.name: logger
static-class.description: Utility for instrumenting a logging API into an object. Logging facilities use the Message Service message block format of: ###.#.###.### where the first set identifies the global scope, the second is the level, the third is the inner scope, and the fourth is the fine scope.

example.description: Demonstrate how to use the Logger with an existing object.
example.name: Example Log
example.code: // The '900' block is an arbitrary value of 1 - 999
// Define a function to receive all log messages
// Listen for log messages on the same object
// Test it out, optionally supply a numeric code pair (###.###) to identify message origination.
// The entire code for the message would be: 900.4.100.1

method.name: logError
method.param: Message to send to the logger.
method.description: Sends a message in the #100.5 message block.

method.name: logWarning
method.param: Message to send to the logger.
method.description: Sends a message in the ###.4 message block.

method.name: logDebug
method.param: Message to send to the logger.
method.description: Sends a message in the ###.1 message block.

method.name: logFatal
method.param: Message to send to the logger.
method.description: Sends a message in the ###.7 message block.

method.name: logAdvisory
method.param: Message to send to the logger.
method.description: Sends a message in the ###.2 message block.

method.name: log
method.param: Message to send to the logger.
method.description: Sends a message in the ###.3 message block.

method.name: addLogger
method.param: Object onto which the logger will be instrumented.
The logging context. The context must be between 1 and 999. If the context already exists, then the first context to define the name and description will be used.
method.description: Instruments the specified logger with a context sensitive logging facility.
